EvSail-2.5 has been released.  It's a free download
from http://sourceforge.net/projects/annevolve.
EvSail is a program that uses neuroevolution to obtain
an artificial neural network that can navigate a
simulated sailboat.  It is written in standard C and
will compile and execute correctly on all platforms. 
There is no graphics included in the software,
although trajectory tables are produced that are
easily plotted with gnuplot or other graphing utility.

The ANN created by EvSail guides the simulated
sailboat by continuously adjusting the rudder and sail
angle in order to circumnavigate an island in shifting
winds.  The weights of the ANN are found by simulated
evolution (GA).  The ANN is a multi-layer perceptron
with (optionally) one or two hidden layers.

There is plenty of documentation; everything is
explained in detail.  In addition, questions may be
submittted to the annevolve mailing list, and will
receive prompt answers.

Mitchell Timin

-- 
"In theory, there is no difference between theory and
practice.  In
practice, there is."

http://annevolve.sourceforge.net is for those seeking
something to do with their wetware.


Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
